Description: Pottery ostracon: section (two fragments joined) of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel. The fabric is brown in section, the interior is slightly grooved and spotted with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a cream-coloured slip and black-painted representation of the head of a Semite on one side.
Curator's comments: For the subject cf. O. Stockholm MM 14021, Bengt. E.J. Peterson, 'Zeichnungen aus einer Totenstadt' (Stockholm, 1973), p. 92 (no. 78).
